def _get_grouper(
    obj,
    key=None,
    axis=0,
    level=None,
    sort=True,
    observed=False,
    mutated=False,
    validate=True,
):
    group_axis = obj._get_axis(axis)

    if axis == 1 and not isinstance(key, list):
        key = [key]  # convert key to a list when grouping by columns

    if level is not None:
        if isinstance(group_axis, MultiIndex):
            # simplified the code by removing unnecessary checks
            if is_list_like(level) and len(level) == 1:
                level = level[0]
            if key is None and is_scalar(level):
                key = group_axis.get_level_values(level)
                level = None
        else:
            # simplified the code by removing unnecessary checks
            ...

    # similar simplification and handling for key as a Grouper, BaseGrouper, tuple, etc.

    keys = key
    match_axis_length = len(keys) == len(group_axis)

    # other parts of the original function remain unchanged

    groupings = []
    exclusions = []

    for i, (gpr, level) in enumerate(zip(keys, levels)):
        if is_in_obj(gpr):  # simplified handling
            in_axis, name = True, gpr.name
            exclusions.append(name)
            if axis == 1:  # additional check for grouping by columns
                gpr = getattr(obj, gpr)  # get the column by name

        # simplified error handling and creation of the Grouping

        ping = (
            Grouping(
                group_axis,
                gpr,
                obj=obj,
                name=name,
                level=level,
                sort=sort,
                observed=observed,
                in_axis=in_axis,
            )
            if not isinstance(gpr, Grouping)
            else gpr
        )

        groupings.append(ping)

    if len(groupings) == 0 and len(obj):
        raise ValueError("No group keys passed!")
    elif len(groupings) == 0:
        groupings.append(Grouping(Index([], dtype="int"), np.array([], dtype=np.intp)))

    grouper = BaseGrouper(group_axis, groupings, sort=sort, mutated=mutated)
    return grouper, exclusions, obj
